text.p: Taiwan's Interior Minister Lin Feng-cheng, under fire for a spate of violent crimes on the island, has tendered his resignation to Premier Lien Chan, his office said on Thursday.
Lin was the second cabinet official to resign on Thursday, following the resignation of Ma Ying-jeou, minister without portfolio and a popular politican.
"We have delivered Minister Lin's resignation to the premier's office this morning," an aide to Lin told Reuters by telephone. He declined to give details.
Public discontent over the government's failure to keep law and order has erupted since the strangled body of renowed actress Pai Ping-ping's teenage daughter was found naked in a river last month.
Police said 17-year-old Pai Hsiao-yen had been kidnapped and murdered. The killers remain at large.
More than 50,000 people marched in Taipei on Sunday protesting against Pai's murder and demanding a cabinet reshuffle and Lien's resignation.
